feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily wage calculator" is used to compute daily-rate based salary amounts (e.g., deductions, proration, or settlement-related calculations) based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Ticket evidence repeatedly connects this behaviour to unpaid leave deductions and leave-related payroll adjustments. Evidence indicates calculations may use either calendar days or working days (with weekends/holidays considerations) depending on configuration and scenario. Tickets highlight configuration precedence where global payroll settings can override policy-level settings, creating unexpected outcomes for users. Tickets also report UI/display mismatches (e.g., remarks showing different day counts) even when backend calculations are otherwise consistent. Several tickets suggest recalculation/synchronization gaps where changes (salary config, holidays, deleted requests) do not retroactively update already-generated results. Customer requests frequently ask for greater configurability, clearer transparency, and control over calculation bases and divisors.

known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Current system cannot automatically calculate salary based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking of overtime and unpaid leaves.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days. The platform cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation. The system currently requires manual tracking of overtime, unpaid leaves, and does not support automatic pro-rata salary adjustments per employee.

known_issues.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Daily Wage Formula
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings intentionally overrides the leave policy formula for unpaid leave. The leave policy formula appears greyed out, indicating it is being superseded by the payroll configuration. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration takes precedence over leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists between leave policy and payroll modules for daily wage formula configuration.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were calculated based on outdated salary configurations instead of the most recent salary setup, resulting in incorrect payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform could not automatically recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change.

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Leap Year Miscalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for leap years (specifically 2024), resulting in an inaccurate total service period and lower gratuity amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing inaccurate service period calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: The EOS gratuity calculator requires enhancement to dynamically handle leap year calculations and automatically recognize 366-day years in service period computations.

known_issues.title: End of Service Pro Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: Daily wage calculation for pro-rated amounts is producing consistently lower amounts by 0.1 or 0.2 decimal points. The formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but results in slight undercalculation when computing pro-rated End of Service (EOS) amounts.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation causing systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: Enhanced rounding and decimal handling mechanisms are needed to ensure exact financial calculations for pro-rated salary computations.

known_issues.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: System gratuity calculation shows slight differences from manual calculations, with nuanced rules for service duration and daily wage computation
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation involves complex rules based on service duration, with different rates for first 5 years (21 days per year) and subsequent years (30 days per year)
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential lack of transparency in gratuity calculation logic that makes manual verification challenging

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Leap Year Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (February 29th), causing minor discrepancies in total service days calculation. The system calculated 912 days, while manual calculation included 913 days by explicitly counting the leap day.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently managed
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Precision for Partial Years
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates gratuity with nuanced logic for partial years, specifically handling service periods above 5 years with leap year adjustments. The calculation differs from manual expectations by using 366 as a divisor for incomplete years containing leap year days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation logic is complex and not transparently communicated, leading to potential misunderstandings about partial year and leap year processing.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for more detailed, user-friendly explanation of gratuity calculation logic with worked examples showing service duration calculation for partial years and leap year handling.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Worked in Gratuity Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates 623 days instead of 622 days when computing employee service tenure, potentially impacting gratuity calculation accuracy.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Minor inconsistency in days worked calculation, adding one extra day to total service duration
known_issues.gap_statement: Precision issue in days calculation logic that could affect end-of-service benefit computations

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations. The daily wage is divided according to the configured policy setting (30 vs 31 days), potentially causing perceived calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations that may not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths or specific employee scenarios.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation about how leave salary calculations are performed, including clear documentation about daily rate divisor configurations and policy-driven calculations.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Varies by Monthly Working Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator configured with 'working days' setting causes leave salary accrual amounts to fluctuate based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals across months.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations change based on monthly working days, preventing stable leave salary accrual reporting
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a method to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months with varying working days

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system uses different divisors for leave salary and salary proration calculations. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor, while salary proration uses a 30.42-day divisor, causing calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations are configured independently with different divisors
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method across leave salary and salary proration scenarios

known_issues.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Salary proration depends on work week configuration, which may not match traditional calendar day expectations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing. When an employee is offboarded (e.g., on Nov 28th) and payroll is processed earlier (e.g., on Nov 27th), the system displays the full monthly salary instead of the prorated amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration logic does not handle departure dates consistently across different payroll processing scenarios
known_issues.gap_statement: The daily wage calculator lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Request Modification
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductionsâ€”one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems. When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: Clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes out of sync between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The system cannot automatically recalculate daily wage deductions when public holiday configurations change after leave request creation.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules to ensure consistent working days and salary deduction calculations.

known_issues.title: Unexpected Deduction Calculation Method
known_issues.issue_explanation: The payroll system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation uses 30.42 days divisor, not calendar days
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Display in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays incorrect number of days (31 instead of 29) in remarks for February unpaid leave deduction, despite accurate backend calculation. The actual deduction is mathematically correct, but the displayed daily rate in remarks is inconsistent with the correct calendar days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on actual month days.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual policy-specific leave deduction calculations. Unpaid leave deductions are calculated using a global setting instead of policy-level basic salary / working days configuration.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is from the wrong month.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate display does not reflect the leave occurrence month's rate
known_issues.gap_statement: Need a consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves the initially calculated rate at the time of leave request

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary calculation is based on a standard of 26 working days per month, derived from 365 annual days minus 52 weekly offs, resulting in 313 working days per year divided by 12 months.
limitations.impact: Employees' salaries are calculated against a fixed 26-day working month standard

limitations.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Configurations
limitations.limitation_statement: Payroll settings take precedence over leave policy configurations for daily wage calculations, with no automatic synchronization between modules.
limitations.impact: Users cannot directly edit formulas in leave policy when payroll settings are configured

limitations.title: Salary Config Change Impact on Leave Deductions
limitations.limitation_statement: Unpaid leave deductions are dependent on salary configuration timing. If a new salary configuration is created after a leave request, the deduction may not automatically update to reflect the current salary.
limitations.impact: Potential payroll calculation inaccuracies

limitations.title: Incorrect Leap Year Day Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: The system defaults to 365 days for all years, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in service period calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential underpayment of employee end of service gratuity benefits

limitations.title: Inconsistent Pro-Rated Amount Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Pro-rated End of Service amounts are consistently calculated with a small decimal precision error, affecting the accuracy of final settlements for employees leaving mid-month.
limitations.impact: Employees may receive slightly less than their expected pro-rated amount during final settlement

limitations.title: Mid-Month Departure Leave Accrual Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave days are accrued at end of month, meaning incomplete months are not automatically included in End of Service (EOS) calculations
limitations.impact: Employees departing mid-month will not have current month's leave days automatically included in their final settlement

limitations.title: Ambiguous Day Counting Methodology
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, specifically around departure date inclusion and leap year day handling
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity amount calculation

limitations.title: Leap Year Day Counting Methodology
limitations.limitation_statement: System uses 366 as divisor for incomplete years containing leap year days, which can cause slight variations in gratuity calculations compared to manual methods.
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in end of service (EOS) benefit calculations for employees with service periods spanning leap years

limitations.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of daily wage calculation for different organizational requirements

limitations.title: Inflexible Daily Wage Divisor
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform cannot automatically adjust the daily wage divisor based on month length. The divisor is fixed in policy configuration and cannot be easily overridden per individual leave request.
limitations.impact: Users cannot modify the standard calculation method to account for specific monthly variations

limitations.title: Leave Encashment Calculation Based on Monthly Working Days
limitations.limitation_statement: The daily wage calculator uses a 'working days' method that recalculates daily rates based on the number of working days in each month
limitations.impact: Cumulative leave salary accruals will vary month-to-month due to different working day counts

limitations.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
limitations.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors
limitations.impact: Potential calculation inconsistencies and manual configuration required to align methods

limitations.title: Proration Depends on Work Week Setup
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation and proration are directly tied to the configured work week, which can result in full month calculation if all 7 days are marked as working days
limitations.impact: Salary proration may differ from traditional calendar day expectations based on specific work week configuration

limitations.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
limitations.limitation_statement: The system only correctly prorates salaries when departure dates are in the past, failing to handle future departure dates during payroll processing
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect salary calculations for employees being offboarded

limitations.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave management system does not properly sync with payroll deduction module when leave transactions are modified, deleted, or have status changed.
limitations.impact: Users cannot reliably recalculate unpaid leave deductions without generating duplicate or persistent incorrect payroll entries.

limitations.title: Lack of Real-Time Module Communication
limitations.limitation_statement: Time Off module does not send complete leave request details to Payroll module at the time of calculation, preventing accurate working days determination.
limitations.impact: Incorrect salary deductions when public holidays are added after leave requests

limitations.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: System uses a fixed 30.42 days divisor for calculating daily wage, which may not align with calendar months
limitations.impact: Deduction amounts may slightly exceed expected monthly salary

limitations.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations must account for varying number of days in different months, especially February in leap years.
limitations.impact: Potential discrepancies in unpaid leave deduction calculations if not handled precisely

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy Configurations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unable to automatically prorate salary based on working days
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Current payroll system lacks built-in automation for attendance-based salary calculation
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Use a mix of unpaid leaves and overtime tracking, managed separately for each employee

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Incorrect unpaid leave deduction amount due to outdated salary configuration
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Leave request created before new salary configuration was set up
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Delete the existing leave request and recreate it after ensuring the latest salary configuration is in place

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy in gratuity calculation between system and MOHRE verification
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System uses 365 days for all years, missing leap year adjustment
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually verify and adjust gratuity calculation to include 366 days for leap years

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Incorrect pro-rated amount showing less than expected (e.g., 89,999.9 instead of 9000)
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Decimal precision error in daily wage calculation formula (basic + allowances / 30)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify calculations manually and cross-check with development team

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Leave balance not automatically included for mid-month departure
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Monthly accrual policy restricts automatic prorating of leave days
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually adjust leave balance in EOS section or switch to conditional daily accrual policy

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy between system-calculated and client-edited gratuity amount
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System calculates gratuity based on specific methodology, but allows manual client editing of the final amount
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify calculation methodology and confirm total service days manually

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Difference between manual and system gratuity calculations
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Variations arise from system's precise handling of partial years, especially those including leap year days
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify calculation by breaking down service period into segments: first 5 years at 21 days per year, subsequent years at 30 days per year, with careful handling of partial years

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Differences between manual and system gratuity calculations
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Fixed daily wage divisor and precise days worked calculation method
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually verify calculations using platform's specific method of (Basic / 30) and exact days worked

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Perceived discrepancy in leave salary amount
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Calculation follows predefined policy configuration for daily rate, which may differ from user's manual calculation expectations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily rate configuration in leave policy settings and understand the system's calculation logic before challenging the computed amount

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Inconsistent leave salary accrual totals across months
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Daily wage calculator set to 'working days' method, causing monthly calculation variations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Switch to 'custom days' setting in leave encashment configuration for more consistent calculations

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Verify work week configuration to understand how working days are calculated
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Check employee's assigned work week policy and confirm if all days are marked as working days

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Full monthly salary displayed for partially worked month
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Calculation logic does not account for departure date relative to payroll processing date
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually calculate and adjust prorated salary based on days worked

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Persistent payroll deductions after leave request deletion

troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manual intervention required to remove duplicate or orphaned deductions

claims_to_validate.statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days. The platform cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Daily Wage Formula
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings intentionally overrides the leave policy formula for unpaid leave. The leave policy formula appears greyed out, indicating it is being superseded by the payroll configuration. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were calculated based on outdated salary configurations instead of the most recent salary setup, resulting in incorrect payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: End of Service Gratuity Leap Year Miscalculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The system incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for leap years (specifically 2024), resulting in an inaccurate total service period and lower gratuity amount.

claims_to_validate.title: End of Service Pro Rated Amount Calculation Error
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculation for pro-rated amounts is producing consistently lower amounts by 0.1 or 0.2 decimal points. The formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but results in slight undercalculation when computing pro-rated End of Service (EOS) amounts.

claims_to_validate.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy
claims_to_validate.statement: Gratuity calculation involves complex rules based on service duration, with different rates for first 5 years (21 days per year) and subsequent years (30 days per year)

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Leap Year Discrepancy
claims_to_validate.statement: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (February 29th), causing minor discrepancies in total service days calculation. The system calculated 912 days, while manual calculation included 913 days by explicitly counting the leap day.

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Precision for Partial Years
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates gratuity with nuanced logic for partial years, specifically handling service periods above 5 years with leap year adjustments. The calculation differs from manual expectations by using 366 as a divisor for incomplete years containing leap year days.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Worked in Gratuity Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates 623 days instead of 622 days when computing employee service tenure, potentially impacting gratuity calculation accuracy.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations. The daily wage is divided according to the configured policy setting (30 vs 31 days), potentially causing perceived calculation discrepancies.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Varies by Monthly Working Days
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator configured with 'working days' setting causes leave salary accrual amounts to fluctuate based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals across months.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The system uses different divisors for leave salary and salary proration calculations. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor, while salary proration uses a 30.42-day divisor, causing calculation discrepancies.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
claims_to_validate.statement: User misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
claims_to_validate.statement: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing. When an employee is offboarded (e.g., on Nov 28th) and payroll is processed earlier (e.g., on Nov 27th), the system displays the full monthly salary instead of the prorated amount.

claims_to_validate.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Request Modification
claims_to_validate.statement: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductionsâ€”one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes out of sync between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.

claims_to_validate.title: Unexpected Deduction Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: The payroll system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Display in Unpaid Leave Remarks
claims_to_validate.statement: The system displays incorrect number of days (31 instead of 29) in remarks for February unpaid leave deduction, despite accurate backend calculation. The actual deduction is mathematically correct, but the displayed daily rate in remarks is inconsistent with the correct calendar days.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual policy-specific leave deduction calculations. Unpaid leave deductions are calculated using a global setting instead of policy-level basic salary / working days configuration.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
claims_to_validate.statement: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is from the wrong month.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary calculation is based on a standard of 26 working days per month, derived from 365 annual days minus 52 weekly offs, resulting in 313 working days per year divided by 12 months.

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Configurations
claims_to_validate.statement: Payroll settings take precedence over leave policy configurations for daily wage calculations, with no automatic synchronization between modules.

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Config Change Impact on Leave Deductions
claims_to_validate.statement: Unpaid leave deductions are dependent on salary configuration timing. If a new salary configuration is created after a leave request, the deduction may not automatically update to reflect the current salary.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Leap Year Day Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The system defaults to 365 days for all years, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in service period calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Pro-Rated Amount Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Pro-rated End of Service amounts are consistently calculated with a small decimal precision error, affecting the accuracy of final settlements for employees leaving mid-month.

claims_to_validate.title: Mid-Month Departure Leave Accrual Limitation
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave days are accrued at end of month, meaning incomplete months are not automatically included in End of Service (EOS) calculations

claims_to_validate.title: Ambiguous Day Counting Methodology
claims_to_validate.statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, specifically around departure date inclusion and leap year day handling

claims_to_validate.title: Leap Year Day Counting Methodology
claims_to_validate.statement: System uses 366 as divisor for incomplete years containing leap year days, which can cause slight variations in gratuity calculations compared to manual methods.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor Limitation
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas

claims_to_validate.title: Inflexible Daily Wage Divisor
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform cannot automatically adjust the daily wage divisor based on month length. The divisor is fixed in policy configuration and cannot be easily overridden per individual leave request.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Encashment Calculation Based on Monthly Working Days
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator uses a 'working days' method that recalculates daily rates based on the number of working days in each month

claims_to_validate.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
claims_to_validate.statement: The Bayzat platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Depends on Work Week Setup
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculation and proration are directly tied to the configured work week, which can result in full month calculation if all 7 days are marked as working days

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
claims_to_validate.statement: The system only correctly prorates salaries when departure dates are in the past, failing to handle future departure dates during payroll processing

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave management system does not properly sync with payroll deduction module when leave transactions are modified, deleted, or have status changed.

claims_to_validate.title: Lack of Real-Time Module Communication
claims_to_validate.statement: Time Off module does not send complete leave request details to Payroll module at the time of calculation, preventing accurate working days determination.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: System uses a fixed 30.42 days divisor for calculating daily wage, which may not align with calendar months

claims_to_validate.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations must account for varying number of days in different months, especially February in leap years.

claims_to_validate.title: Global Settings Override Policy Configurations
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily rate calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
